before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"45j6j","text":"Wipe bench surfaces with PCR clean wipes and keep working environment clean.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"f6rjd","text":"Cost-efficient library generation by early barcoding has been central in propelling single-cell RNA sequencing. Here, we optimize and validate prime-seq, an early barcoding bulk RNA-seq method. We show that it performs equivalently to TruSeq, a standard bulk RNA-seq method, but is fourfold more cost-efficient due to almost 50-fold cheaper library costs. We conclude that prime-seq is currently one of the best options to set up an early barcoding bulk RNA-seq protocol from which many labs would profit.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9sp5r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1hug6","text":"WEHI advanced Genomics facility amendments from Prime-seq:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":58}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bhi3c","text":"The plasticware has been changed from 96w plates to 384w and volumes have been reduced 1/4. The reverse transcription of Prime-Seq does not use RNase inhibitors, which I have included.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1hvio","text":"The primers used for full length cDNA amplification have been taken from 10x Genomics chemistry. This adds compatibility with ONT sequencing (FLT-Seq) developed by Jafar and compatibility with 10x Genomics indexing primers set TT.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
